content:
Sure, there are plenty of vegetarian dishes in Rawalpindi that are not too spicy. Here are some recommendations:

1. Daal makhani - a creamy lentil dish made with black lentils, kidney beans, cream, and mild spices.
2. Aloo gobi - a stir-fry dish made with potatoes, cauliflower, and spices.
3. Chana masala - a chickpea curry made with tomatoes, onions, and a blend of spices.
4. Palak paneer - a spinach-based curry made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese) and mild spices.
5. Baingan bharta - a mashed eggplant dish made with tomatoes, onions, and mild spices.

Many restaurants will also adjust the level of spice in their dishes upon request, so don't hesitate to ask. Enjoy your local culinary adventure at Rawalpindi!
